item.title: Tesla aims to launch robotaxi with teleoperator backup, says Deutsche Bank
item.description: The electric vehicle maker still is shooting for a launch of its cheaper vehicle in the first half of next year and other models later in the year, the bank said after the meeting with investor relations chief Travis Axelrod. It published the note on Friday.

item.title: NATRAX and IIT Madras join hands for advanced automotive research, road safety
item.description: NATRAX and CAAR plan to work together in road safety by taking up pilot projects with a larger aim of zero fatalities. As part of the agreement, NATRAX and CAAR will collaborate to work on automotive research, innovation, skill development, and knowledge exchange.

item.title: 'Decarbonisation remains the commercial vehicle industry's top challenge'
item.description: The company which is aiming to transform a mechanical piece (CV) into a software-defined vehicle believes in clean mobility fuel solutions for the CV industry. However, DTICI believes decarbonisation is a goal that is yet to be fulfilled by the commercial vehicle industry. This shift will follow a fast momentum through the adoption of alternative fuels such as hydrogen, biofuels, and renewable energy, along with innovations in fuel cell technology for abiding by strict emission standards while ensuring high performance.

item.title: ADAS in commercial vehicles: The future of safer, smarter and more profitable transportation
item.description: The most obvious argument of all. ADAS provides drivers with an extra set of eyes, alerting them to potential dangers and assisting in emergencies. Features like collision warnings, lane-keeping assistance, and blind-spot monitoring reduce risks, particularly in challenging road conditions. Moreover, night driving, which accounted for 20.4% of all accidents in 2022, becomes safer with Night Vision Assistance (NVA), available even with level 1 ADAS, by improving visibility and helping drivers maintain control in low-visibility conditions

item.title: A tango of intelligence: Smart vehicles demand smart roads
item.description: “As our vehicles become smarter and more connected, so must our road infrastructure and supporting safety solutions. Gone are the days when every aspect of the road ecosystem was addressed in silos, leading to a fragmented mix of approaches. The need of the hour is a comprehensive strategy that integrates Intelligent Traffic Management Systems (ITMS) and communication infrastructure at the core of road project design. This holistic approach will ensure seamless connectivity, enhanced safety, and a smarter mobility ecosystem.”

item.title: IIT Guwahati develops tech to convert methane, carbon dioxide into eco-friendly biofuel
item.description: Debasish Das, professor in the Department of Biosciences and Bioengineering, IIT Guwahati, explained that the greenhouse gas methane is 27 to 30 times more potent than carbon dioxide and is a significant contributor to global warming.

item.title: New EV charging technology under testing at VNIT
item.description: This advanced technology, under development at VNIT's Power Electronics Research Laboratory (PERL), claims to be game-changer in the electric vehicle (EV) charging sector.

item.title: ‘India can continue to be the ICE capital of the world’
item.description: It's an interesting time in the global automobile business. While on one hand, the EV megatrend progresses, emission regimes for ICE (Internal Combustion Engine) vehicles are getting more stringent. The European Union has notified its industry about Euro 7, which also means that BSVII may not be too far away.

item.title: BAJA SAEINDIA 2025 organises vehicle design competition with Chitkara University, Chandigarh
item.description: BAJA SAEINDIA 2025 features engineering students designing, manufacturing, and competing with single-seater ATVs. It includes virtual and physical rounds hosted by various institutes, with events focusing on innovation and sustainability. This season sees increased participation in hydrogen and autonomous vehicle categories, highlighting the competition's role in preparing future mobility engineers.

item.title: Cameras, app to track ticketless travel on Mumbai's BEST buses
item.description: BEST is adopting technology to enhance services and monitor bus driver behavior, implementing audit cameras for passenger counts, mobile apps for monitoring ticketless travel, and driver consoles. They plan to expand digital ticketing and the tap-in, tap-out fare system across more city buses, while also investing in the power distribution network.

item.title: China's Didi reports third-quarter rebound from regulatory crackdown
item.description: China's largest ride-hailing company Didi Global reported third-quarter net income of 929 million yuan ($128.42 million) on Friday, as it built back its business after a regulatory crackdown.

item.title: Mercedes to use Momenta software in 4 models, accelerate China comeback, sources say
item.description: Mercedes-Benz is planning a $75-million investment in autonomous driving startup Momenta to enhance its market share in China. This partnership aims to incorporate Momenta's software into at least four future Mercedes models to be launched in China between 2025 and 2027, with potential expansion to other regions.

item.title: Hinduja Tech acquires TECOSIM group to enhance global mobility engineering services
item.description: Hinduja Tech Limited has acquired TECOSIM Group, a European engineering services provider, to expand its presence in Europe and strengthen its global market position. This move brings together TECOSIM's expertise in virtual validation and body engineering with Hinduja Tech's capabilities, aiming to deliver innovative mobility solutions and drive future automotive engineering advancements.

item.title: Alternative fuels key to making India self-reliant: Nitin Gadkari
item.description: Minister Nitin Gadkari emphasizes the importance of switching to biofuels and electric vehicles for sustainable development. India's transport sector heavily contributes to air pollution, and significant fossil fuels are imported annually. Initiatives like bio-CNG projects and municipal waste-to-bio-CNG projects are promoting a green economy, creating jobs, boosting exports, and making India self-reliant.

item.title: Why OTA updates feature is becoming essential for modern vehicles
item.description: The OTA system leverages secure connectivity—be it Wi-Fi, LTE, or 5G—to push updates from a centralised cloud server to individual vehicles. These updates are typically downloaded and stored until the vehicle is idle, at which point they are installed, ensuring minimal disruption and robust security. Currently, OTA updates mainly address infotainment systems, navigation, telematics, diagnostics, performance tuning, and driver assistance systems (ADAS), paving the way for a seamless and efficient user experience.

item.title: China's Robotaxi co Pony AI raises USD 260 mn in US IPO
item.description: Pony AI's listing may show how US investors approach China-based companies under Donald Trump's administration, especially as the two biggest economies in the world vie for dominance in high-stakes industries such as autonomous driving. The company is set to join a growing cohort of China-based firms tapping US capital markets in recent times.

item.title: What industry wants for H2ICE adoption; govt seeks stronger representation for tech roadmap
item.description: Hydrogen technology is pegged to be a potential game changer in India's journey to achieve carbon neutrality by 2070. However, there are hurdles for Hydrogen adoption. Key among them are cost, and a favourable ecosystem. The Government official also says that "mission-mode efforts" are required from the automotive industry. He advocated for a need to break the silos, and also said that there aren't enough pressure groups from the industry. Stakeholders are encouraged to make more representations, backed by facts and figures, for new technology support.

item.title: China's Hesai to halve lidar prices next year, sees wide adoption in electric cars
item.description: "We are moving to a stage where millions of cars sold annually are equipped with lidar," Chief Executive David Li told Reuters in an interview. Halving the price would make the use of lidar appealing even for cheaper EVs priced below 150,000 yuan (USD 20,000), he added.

item.title: Generative AI and robotics are redefining manufacturing in Asia and beyond, says Rockwell Automation's Scott Wooldridge
item.description: In an exclusive interaction with ETAuto at Automation Fair, Anaheim, California, Scott Wooldridge discussed the evolving role of technology in manufacturing, including digital twins, AI-driven decision-making, collaborative robots (cobots), and autonomous operations.

item.title: Analog Devices beats Q4 targets on chip demand recovery from auto industry
item.description: The auto industry had been grappling with an inventory glut due to sluggish demand, translating to lower production and fewer orders for semiconductors, which hurt business at Analog in the past few quarters.
